author: Valentina Raffio
title: La DANA coge fuerza en Andalucía y obliga a activar una alerta roja en Huelva
text: La DANA ha vuelto a activarse este viernes desde primera hora de la mañana de este viernes y, según los pronósticos más actualizados, mantiene en alerta a al menos cinco comunidades autónomas. Esta mañana la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (AEMET) ha activado una alerta roja para el litoral de Huelva, donde se podrían dar acumulaciones de más de 140 litros por metro cuadrado en tan solo unas horas. En localidades como Cartaya ya se han acumulado más de 117 litros por metro cuadrado en menos de tres horas, de los cuales 70 en un hora. También se están registrando importantes trombas marinas asociadas a este evento. Las autoridades piden a los ciudadanos de la zona extremar precauciones. Para este viernes también hay activadas varias alertas amarillas en el sur de Cataluña, el norte de la Comunitat Valenciana y en Mallorca y Menorca ante el riesgo de que la DANA vuelva a causar lluvias torrenciales en estas zonas. En Catalunya, el aviso naranja se concentra en las comarcas del Montsià y Baix Ebre, que acumulan dos días consecutivos de lluvias extremas, ante la previsión de que caigan más de 100 litros por metro cuadrado durante esta jornada. También se activa una alerta amarilla en el litoral y prelitoral de Barcelona de cara a toda la jornada del viernes ante la previsión de fuertes lluvias que podrían llegar acompañadas de tormenta. En las próximas horas preocupa la evolución de esta DANA en la Comunidad Valenciana. Las imágenes por radar muestran la formación de un frente muy cargado de lluvias delante de las costas de Castellón, una zona que este jueves ya vivió una jornada en alerta roja y sufrió varias inundaciones. En la zona más afectada por el paso de este temporal extremo, en Valencia, para este viernes se ha activado una alerta amarilla y se esperan acumulaciones de entre 20 y 60 litros por metro cuadrado en algunos puntos. Además de las alertas rojas y naranjas activadas para este viernes, la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología también ha activado decenas de avisos de nivel amarillo en Andalucía, Baleares, Cataluña, Extremadura y Comunidad Valenciana, ya que las lluvias van a ser también muy fuertes en grandes áreas de estas regiones y en muchos puntos se van a acumular hasta 60 litros por metro cuadrado en doce horas. \"Vamos a lanzar un mensaje muy claro y lo vamos a dejar fijado. La emergencia meteorológica no ha finalizado. La DANA sigue sobre España\", afirman desde la entidad ante la previsión de que estas lluvias torrenciales sigan. Los modelos aún se muestran inciertos sobre cómo evolucionará esta DANA en los próximos días. Este episodio empezó ya el fin de semana pasado, se ha extendido durante todo esta semana y seguramente continuará durante todo el puente de Todos los Santos y el fin de semana. A partir de ahí, aún no está muy claro cuándo acabarán definitivamente estas lluvias. Por ahora, todo apunta a que a principios de la semana que viene se debilitarán mucho y probablemente se vayan apaciguando con el tiempo. Aun así, dada la evolución errática de este fenómeno, aún es pronto para ponerle fecha final a este episodio que ha causado tantas lluvias torrenciales.

author: Shawn Fleetwood
title: Ex-Girlfriend: Kamala Harris’ Husband Slapped Me In The Face
text: The alleged ex-girlfriend of Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff has come forward accusing him of slapping her across the face, according to a report released Thursday. Speaking with the Daily Mail, the woman, who has reportedly chosen to remain anonymous, contended that the outlet’s prior reporting about the incident in question is true. As The Federalist’s Tristan Justice previously noted , three friends of the alleged victim claimed to the Daily Mail that Emhoff — the husband of Vice President Kamala Harris — “struck the woman named under the pseudonym ‘Jane’ following a glitzy night out at the 2012 Cannes Film Festival in France.” The alleged victim’s friends also provided photos, “other documents and communications corroborating elements of the story,” according to the outlet . Described by the Daily Mail as a “successful New York attorney,” the accuser reportedly did not want to go on the record at the time the outlet published its first story on the alleged incident. According to the Daily Mail, she changed her mind after witnessing Emhoff’s “alleged hypocrisy by claiming to be a feminist in media interviews, [which] finally became too much for her.” “What’s frightening for a woman that’s been on the other end of it, is watching this completely fabricated persona being portrayed,” she said. “He’s being held out to be the antithesis of who he actually is. And that is utterly shocking.” Emhoff is a central figure in his wife’s presidential campaign, and legacy media have attempted to cast him as a model of masculinity and a champion of women. The second gentleman has yet to directly deny the allegations made against him. While he https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-13898791/Kamala-Harris-husband-Doug-Emhoff-accused-ex-girlfriend-slap.html didn’t respond to the Daily Mail’s request for comment on its initial story, an Emhoff spokesman told Semafor , “this report is untrue” and “any suggestion that he would or has ever hit a woman is false.” The claims were subtly touched upon during Emhoff’s recent MSNBC interview , in which network host Joe Scarborough indirectly classified the Daily Mail’s reporting as “misinformation” that’s being promoted by Donald Trump. Harris’ husband agreed, calling it a “distraction.” Speaking with the Daily Mail, the New York attorney expressed outrage at the lack of media coverage of reports that Emhoff impregnated his daughter’s nanny at the time he was married to his now-ex-wife. The second gentleman previously confirmed his infidelity, although it is unclear if the alleged child was killed via abortion, given up for adoption, or lost as the result of a miscarriage. “I’ve been telling this story to my friends. And I kept saying, this is a big deal, why doesn’t anybody in the media care? And apparently nobody did,” she said. “Not a single reporter has directly asked Doug about these allegations.” The ex-girlfriend denied her allegations are politically motivated, contending she and her husband are registered Democrats and previously voted for and donated to Joe Biden during the 2020 election. The Daily Mail “obtained Federal Election Commission records evidencing the donations, and voter registrations showing the couple’s previous registration as Democrats,” according to the outlet.

author: Estelle Greeff
title: Government Communications warns public about severe weather predictions
text:
Public notice: Severe weather and need for public to take precautions
The South African Weather Service has issued severe weather alerts including severe thunderstorms, damaging and strong winds, and disruptive rains in the Provinces of Western Cape, Eastern Cape, Northern Cape, KwaZulu-Natal, North West and Free State. Government is urging residents in these Provinces to take precautions and follow instructions from respective Disaster Management Centres to keep safe. The contact numbers of the relevant provincial Disaster Management Centres are:
- • Eastern Cape: Mabandla P. – 071 604 3160
- • Northern Cape: Gaolaolwe T. – 083 390 2920
- • Western Cape: Diener C. – 082 550 6770
- • KwaZulu-Natal: Ngema S. – 066 475 2308
- • North West: Mutloane D. – 066 030 8026
- • Free State: Butler F. – 066 487 4896
National Disaster Management Centre: Dr. Elias Sithole: 082 490 9825
Government has noted the damages already caused by the inclement weather and the responses of first responders in the Provinces of KwaZulu-Natal, Gauteng, Mpumalanga and Limpopo.
The National Disaster Management Centre is supporting all Provincial and Municipal Disaster Management Centres to assist the affected communities.
We all have the responsibility to assist government and disaster managers keep us safe.
Weather warnings are available at
https://www.weathersa.co.za/home/warnings
Media enquiries:
Ms Nomonde Mnukwa
Acting Government Spokesperson
Mobile: 083 653 7486

author: Israel Ojoko
title: Uganda Welcomes Salaam Bank, Its First Islamic Banking Pioneer, Amidst Economic Optimism
text:
On a landmark Wednesday, Uganda embraced a significant milestone in its financial sector with the official inauguration of Salaam Bank Limited, the nation's inaugural Islamic banking-compliant institution.
Advertisment This development, presided over by President Yoweri Museveni in Kampala, marks a pivotal moment following the recent legislation that welcomed Islamic banking into the East African country. Islamic finance, adhering to Islamic religious tenets, prohibits interest payments and shuns investments in areas like gambling, heralding a new era of banking in Uganda.
Historic Launch: A New Dawn for Uganda's Financial Landscape The establishment of Salaam Bank Limited, a subsidiary of the Djibouti-based Salaam Group, signifies Uganda's commitment to diversifying its financial services and catering to the unique needs of its Muslim population.
Advertisment The bank's operations, grounded in Sharia principles, offer a range of services from savings to loans, all operated on a profit-sharing basis rather than conventional interest-based models. This innovative approach to banking is expected to attract not only the Muslim community but also other sectors of the population seeking ethical financial solutions.
During the Ramadan prayers, President Museveni articulated his vision of leveraging Islamic banking as a tool for poverty eradication in Uganda. Highlighting the importance of income-generating activities and the Parish Development Model for Muslims, the President assured his government's support for Salaam Bank. He stressed the significance of Islamic banking principles, which prioritize profit sharing over interest payments, in fostering economic empowerment and inclusive financial growth.
Implications and Future Prospects Advertisment The launch of Salaam Bank is not merely a new banking option but a strategic move towards inclusive economic development in Uganda. By offering interest-free banking services, Salaam Bank is poised to attract a broader clientele, including those previously marginalized by conventional banking practices.
This initiative also aligns with Uganda's broader economic goals of promoting financial inclusion and reducing poverty levels across the nation. The success of Salaam Bank could inspire other African countries to explore Islamic banking, potentially transforming the continent's financial landscape.
As Uganda celebrates this groundbreaking achievement, the future of Islamic banking looks promising. With strong government support and a clear mandate to serve the financial needs of all Ugandans, Salaam Bank is set to play a crucial role in the country's journey towards economic prosperity and social cohesion. Its establishment is a testament to Uganda's progressive stance on financial innovation and inclusivity, heralding a new chapter in the nation's economic narrative.
